Barceló Emperatriz Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 39 reviews

Puerta America hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 212 reviews

this was an amazing 5star hotel! we got the choice to choose our room on arrival, either smoking or non smoking.

i have to say some rooms are made for couples because some bathrooms are very see through! unless you want you friends to see you naked lol... the elevators needed your room key to access therefore you feel safe that it's only people who work and stay there. the hotel gives a tour of every floor and room everyday but you have to book it in advance. the coolest rooms was floor 12, the presidential suite! it was really modern and massive but really expensive to stay in. the staff was really friendly and helpful, breakfast buffet was nice. i must say, me and my boyfriend loved it and if we was to go back to madrid we would stay here again.

Show more
Mimi , United Kingdom
Gran Melia Fenix Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 76 reviews

The Melia group is not one I would ordinarily have chosen but Real Madrid were at home to Barcelona and we had left it too late to get the hotels that we would have preferred.

As it turned out, our room at the Fenix was both spacious and excellently fitted and the service on the "red level" floor was excellent. The reception staff downstairs were more as I would have expected - trained but not too interested - but the red level really did tick all the boxes.

Show more
jonathan , United Kingdom
Hotel Quatro Puerta del Sol
8.2 Excellent
Based on 360 reviews

Very disappointing stay. Checked in at 9 (for 3 nights) after an overnight train to Madrid. The receptionist made very sure that I know I could only have breakfast from the next morning.

Of course I accepted. When I tried to order a coffee to my room, I was told that there's no room service. (Also no extra cup of coffee from the breakfast room!) After unpacking at 9:30, I phoned down to hand in laundry, to which I was told that unfortunately the laundry deadline was 30 mins ago and that there's no way of getting it done over the weekend - that was a Friday morning. I would have appreciated it if the receptionist would at least have phoned to see if my laundry could still be done - it was only 30 mins late and the prices for laundry is VERY high, so I'm sure the laundry company would have wanted to make a few extra euros out of someone. I also found a few long hairs in the bathroom. And to crown everything, both receptionists (especially the one wirking the later shift) are extremely sour and unpleasant! The stay was very bad, but the location is excellent.

Show more
Hendrik , South Africa
Iberostar Las Letras Gran Via Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 69 reviews

Perfect location and easy to find if you get the metro from the airport. We only stayed for 3 nights but loved the room.

It was a bit noisey during nights because it was right on a main road but that can't be helped. We were really disappointed that the roof terrace was closed during our stay because of works being done on it, which we weren't forewarned about at the time of booking.

Show more
Grant , United Kingdom
Catalonia Atocha Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 211 reviews

My wife and I enjoyed a good 2-day (Sunday and Monday) stay at the tail-end of the street-sweepers' strike, which was of no consequence to us directly while inside the hotel itself.

..the side of the hotel along Atocha Blvd. (front of Hotel) always appeared clean to us. We requested a quiet room and definitely got that. No view to speak of from our window but it was far more important to us that our room be quiet. Though not huge, our room was adequate in size and well laid-out with good closet space, and the bed was quite comfortable. WiFi worked well. The bathroom was well-equipped and reasonably-sized; the shower itself was surprisingly large and the fancy showerhead and body-shower worked very well. Also, we appreciated the towel-warmer. There were no carpets on the floor (7th floor) either in the hallway or in our room; but the hardwood floor was not unattractive and didn't detract from our enjoyment of our stay. Every member of the front desk staff we encountered were quite pleasant and spoke English well enough to answer all our questions and to provide us with the information and advice we needed to get us to where we wanted to go efficiently. The breakfast room was really nice, as were the cooks and servers we encountered. Newspapers in English and Spanish were available. We liked the eggs and omelets to order. There were lots of fruits, breads, pastries, cold cuts, cheeses, yogurts, cereal, fresh orange juice and other juices. There were toasters and two very nice coffee machines that make individual cups of different kinds of tasty coffee selections. One of the best breakfast buffets we've experienced lately.

Show more
Robert , United States
Hotel Opera
8.4 Excellent
Based on 85 reviews

Location is very convenient - center of the city, walking distance to metro, palace, shopping streets.

.. Nice restaurants nearby. Breakfast place is enclosed room but food is fine. Room is very clean, nice view with blossoms just outside of the window, very comfortable bed. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They even have a staff who can speak my native language. Nice experiences in staying at the hotel. Except the room is bit too small.

Show more
Bolin , China
Hotel Exe Plaza
7.8 Very good
Based on 77 reviews

Although is 10 stops away from the old city (center) is conveniently located in a quite area with the station Plaza de la Concordia at 100mt from the door of the hotel! The ride is only 20 minutes to the main attraction and after you whole walking day - you happy to return in your 4 star hotel to chill a relax.

Only negative points I could spot: - lacking of restaurants or bar around the entire hotel area (make sure you are satiated when you return to the hotel) - not all the staff is under good training and perhaps I got some false information which cost me a lot of time waste.. Anyway, should I have chance to go back to Madrid, I would stay again.

Show more
Maurizio , Italy
Dear Hotel Madrid
8.9 Excellent
Based on 41 reviews

Hotel Paseo Del Arte
8.2 Excellent
Based on 418 reviews

We had room 514 on Calle Atocha with a view over the street and Reina Sofia. The room was quite spacious and appointed with nice contemporary furnishings.

The floor was faux wood. The beds were two firm twins together. There was a small TV with a few English channels (mainly news). The bathroom was large, particularly by Euro standards with a full tub/shower, toilet and bidet. Dove crème wash is provided in the tub and by the sink. We had two small room issues… the A/C didn’t seem to have much output (which was OK as the outside temps were 40-60F) and we used the bathroom glasses for sodas and I don’t think these were replaced until day 3 of 4. No big deal. Location couldn’t be beat – right across from Atocha train station (the airport express bus drops off here), across from the Reina Sofia, short distance to the Prado and a 15-20 min. uphill walk to the Plaza Mayor. The hotel is close to the Metro but we walked everywhere. The hotel charges for wi-fi, but there is a McDonald’s down the street and a Starbucks across the street by Reina Sofia with free wi-fi. Nice for downtime. The front desk staff was quite helpful with directions to get to the futbol stadium. We’d definitely recommend!

Show more
Carolyn , United States
ME Madrid Reina Victoria
8.3 Excellent
Based on 68 reviews

Room very modern with comfortable bed. The room's audio-visual system has input sockets to connect your phone/computer/etc.

to view/listen to your own movies and music using the room's excellent speaker system. The hotel restaurant has delicious choice of food. The hotel bar is popular and trendy. All hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel gym is very simple - only some dumbbells and treadmills. (This class of hotel should at least have a universal weight station). The central location of the hotel is within 15 minute walk to museums to the east, cathedral and palace to the west, and central shopping and nightclubs. There are many restaurants within a few streets of the hotel.

Show more
Richard , Australia
NH Collection Madrid Paseo del Prado
8.3 Excellent
Based on 48 reviews

Good. My friend and me booked for 2 days separately. The first time when it says breakfast not included, the nice receptionist told us we it is included.

But for the second time, with another receptionist we when checked in at midnight on Friday, the guy insist as it says breakfast not included, we have to pay for breakfast in the next morning. We paid for different price when we booked these two night but it wasn't a huge difference, we thought it was because of different dates but I don't know why this happened? The nice thing was I only found out that the room I booked was only for 1 adult but they still provided us with a room for 2 adults. Thanks a lot. I will come back to this hotel if I go to Madrid again. The location is good, less than 10 minutes walking to City center and its not noisy at night at all even its in Madrid centre.

Show more
Yadi , China
Eurostars Central
8.4 Excellent
Based on 24 reviews

Vincci The Mint Hotel
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 54 reviews

I was looking for a hotel for my friend and I to have a girls holiday and choose the Vincci the Mint as it looked really great in the photos and a new hotel.

Fantastic location, very central, just steps from Salamanca, Retiro Park and in Chuenca. Lovely hotel, rooms are very high standard, beautiful marble bathrooms, nice areas in the hotel to have a drink or breakfast including the rooftop which is great for an afternoon cocktail after a long day exploring the city. The breakfast a la carte was very good. I will definitely be back.

Show more
Linda , United Kingdom
Hotel Eurostars Casa de la Lirica
8.1 Excellent
Based on 42 reviews

good location and close to lots of restaurants and shopping. there were a few "ladies of the night" hanging around a shopping area not far from the hotel.

walking distance to the city center. wifi is not free as it is in many locations, walked to starbucks or fridays in order to connect without charge. breakfast was just okay, nothing special. beds were as hard as rocks, asked for a room with softer mattress, was told they were all that way. they ended up placing a blanket under the sheets which helped only a little. staff not as friendly and helpful as the last place we stayed. room needed upgrades, still used an old type tv with only a couple of english language channels and one of those was from russia which had a slightly different view of things.

Show more
Michael , United States
Hotel Gran Atlanta Madrid
7.2 Very good
Based on 10 reviews

Vincci Capitol Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 173 reviews

Booked this hotel for our 2-days stay in Madrid and was hugely disappointed. Well, it IS central but you wouldn't like to be SO central - it's like living on Oxford street in London - the busiest place.

Crowds of people and traffic non-stop 24/7. A local bum who is permanently residing on the pavement near the hotel. At entering the place I thought it might be a mistake and I was in a brothel - low light, black shiny panelled walls, curtains and furniture upholstery of dark-violet plush/velvet. Corridors are dark with only large room number boards brightly lit. Our room was probably the tiniest of all. Me and my husband felt claustrophobic. The walls were made of the same shiny plastic as downstairs in the lobby but luckily dove-grey, not black. However, the design was sort of futuristic, so the bathroom door was cancealed in the panelling which added to the impression of being trapped in some cubicle. There was no space for the main door to properly open and it was banging on the sidetable which was in turn banging on the bed. There was no space on the floor to open our luggage either, so we had to put the suitcases on the bed to open them. So if you are on a budget or you find shiny plastic walls cool, you may like the place. If you are a refined traveller with expectations of comfort and style, you rather stay away.

Show more
Elina , Russia
Catalonia Gran Via Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 155 reviews

We booked a double room for 2 people for two nights. When we arrived, they had booked us in for two rooms for one night.

They quickly corrected their error (we had the booking printout) but we were then shown a twin room. When we objected, the best they could do was to offer us a another twin room with the beds pushed together.The rooms themselves were sparse and functional at best. The location on the Gran Vía is excellent but on our experience, apart from the lobby, the hotel was not a four star by any stretch. Be warned that they do not have an iron "for security reasons" any where in the hotel.

Show more
Dermot , Ireland
Leonardo Hotel Madrid City Center
8.1 Excellent
Based on 57 reviews

The stay was good and helped immensely as I had booked for 2 adults and 1 child only to be told that my child was not included.

Although we had to give up the junior suite because of the apparent lack of space in the junior suite the receptionist was very helpful in offering an extra bed for our son to my delight at no charge (which we shouldn't of paid for but I can imagine some hotels may of tried to). We didn't have food, so our comment was average but the only suggestion I would make is that there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room which is slighly inconvenient...other than that, a good stay and would stay there again.

Show more
robert , United Kingdom
NH Nacional
8 Very good
Based on 153 reviews

This was our first time to Spain. We are so lucky that stayed at the right hotel. We went from the Atocha train station and just a 5 mins walk to this hotel.

We stayed there for 3 nights. We were arranged to the top floor with a big balcony that was fantastic. We can say good night every night when we finished our sightseeing. Room does not has a free internet service but we can get free internet at the lobby. The hotel is very convenient to reach to the important sightseeing places like Parque del Buen Retiro, Palacio Velazquez, Palacio de Cristal and Museo del Prado. Alongside hotel has many Spanish restaurants and pubs. Those restaurants open until late night, that is very good for us "owl" to go running at the park, then have a late night dinner and drink right after. The only one thing we think this is a drawback that the lobby can get free internet but we have to ask the hotel people to get a new password and username by every half an hour. They do appreciate to give you but is very inconvenient for the business travel people who need to do some work before sightseeing (like us). Room has an internet service but charges expensive. If people do not need to use internet much, this hotel is a good choice to stay.

Show more
Peter , United States
Sterling Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 67 reviews

The hotel is centrally located near the metro, 5-10mins walk. The main shopping area is nearby. Room and beds ok.

Only one flat pillow and insufficient, could do with another pillow for each bed. Hot shower pressure was fine but hair dryer was wonkey, barely worked. Breakfast was a disappointment, overcrowded and options were crossiants some pastries if you were quick enough, 2 types of cold cuts and cornflakes. Especially bad for us as we don't eat meat, simple boiled/fried eggs would be basic. Checkin 1pm and check out 12noon, bags can be kept at reception storage. Nearest metro - line 2 - santo domingo

Show more
Noor , Singapore
Eurostars Madrid Tower Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 124 reviews

I stayed 3 nites at Eurostars, indeed a great 5 stars hotel, the room and amenities are wonderful, staff are very helpful to provide information and assistance.

The hotel is located at the business center, and there is one shopping mall can be reach by taxi within 8 - 10 minutes (or Euro 6-7) which you can find for good restaurant and shopping. Exit hotel turn right for around 500m, you can find a metro station which you access to any place of interest in Madrid. But for 2-3 days stay, it is better to take Madrid City Bus Tour which you can explore all the place of interest. Please be aware that during the peak hour it is a nightmare to take metro, the metro is packed and not so frequent to catch for another train, and it is always packed and squeezy.

Show more
Sanny , Indonesia
Vincci Soho Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 131 reviews

Rooms are good except for the bathroom that had sewage smell. Probably because of the design of the shower.

Also, the air conditioner wasn't working but its okay because we just kept the windows open and its good because its winter time. Other than that we didn't have any other problem. Another bad thing is that the wifi is only available in the lobby area. In the room there is only one LAN connection. My phones and Ipad need to rely on my computer's internet sharing. Speaks good english (a big plus point if you dont speak much spanish) From my long stay, the front desk had been extremely helpful but there was just ONE of the duty manager that i didn't like because he was just plain reluctant to help. I asked for his help to make a call for me because i dont speak spanish but he just refused to aid me. Other than him, all the others were really really good. Concierge was helpful and friendly too. Location wise, its good because its very near to Plaza Santa Ana (maybe less than 5 mins walk). There are also convenience store around the hotel. The nearest metro station is probably Sol or Sevilla. Both within 15 minutes walking distance. There are few decent restaurants near the hotel as well other than those in Plaza Santa Ana. The Thai restaurant right opposite the hotel is great too. Great food but its advisable to make table reservations because its always packed. Overall a good experience. Housekeeping was good too.

Show more
Mah , Malaysia
Vincci Via 66 Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 91 reviews

A friend choose it for a birthday getaway for two couples. The nice things about it are certainly the good location - it's close to a lots of sights in walking distance and is in a lively aera - the terrace with its cool views and the beautiful Art Deco staircase.

This said, I found the place quite dirty (hairs on the bathroom floor, blanket on the bed smelt funny) and a bit run-down, the tables and crookery at the breakfast were dirty as well and the staff seemed almost non-existent. I think people have smoked in our room before because it didn't smell that good. The beds were two small beds put together and not a french bed as we had required. It's a bit "designer boutique hotel gone wrong", as the place is not ageing well at all. All in all: we had a good time because we decided not to fuss about it, but for this price, in Spain, you do find better places

Show more
Manuela , Switzerland
Catalonia Puerta del Sol Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 56 reviews

We initially booked a hotel around the corner, Hostel Persal. It was cheaper and breakfast included. However, the rooms were very very small.

I am 5-9, 205 lbs and wasnt able to take a shower without elbowing the wall or the curtain sticking to my body. We left the next morning and went to Catolnia. What a difference in customer service, room size, cleanliness. Adrien at the reception and the others, bent over backwards to help us. From booking train tickets to printing them with directions to advice etc. I can't say enough about customer service in this hotel.

Show more
Nagi , United States
Catalonia Las Cortes Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 91 reviews

Our stay at the Catalonia Las Cortes Hotel was excellent! Our room was big and roomy, though we only had one small window that looked into the center of the building.

The bed (actually two Twin-size beds pushed together) was huge and very comfortable. There was a small desk, two closets, and a chair in our room--no dressers with drawers, which would have been nice. The bathroom was also big, with a a decently-sized tub and a marble sink. All in all, a great room. The hotel was also beautiful, though a little easy to miss on the first go-around (though there's a large sign on the side of the building, the front door looks a bit like a window. The staff was very helpful and friendly and spoke excellent English, and the breakfast was just 10 euros per person (per day) and featured a wide variety of meats, cheeses, traditional breakfast foods (both Spanish -- churros -- and American -- eggs and bacon). Perhaps the best part about the hotel was its location -- the Prado and the Thyssen-Bornemisza museums are literally right around the corner, and the Reina Sofia is a ten-minute walk downhill. Puerta del Sol, one of the main shopping areas, is about a five minute walk away, as well. There are also plenty of cute, small restaurants less than a minute from the hotel, and the area is quite lively at night.

Show more
Sarah , United States
Axor Feria Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 458 reviews

We stayed at this hotel for 1 night when we arrived in Madrid, because we wanted something close to the airport after almost 24 hours of traveling.

It was such an amazing deal for the price we paid. The rooms were so clean and modern, and the size was really great for european hotels. The bathroom was big too, and everything was spotless. The girls at the front desk were so helpful. They helped us with all of our questions and went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. The air con worked really well, and the sound proofing was great too. We were never woken up by people outside. We took a taxi to Puerta Atocha for our train to Barcelona, and that cost about 17 euros from the hotel. There is a taxi line right outside the hotel, so it was very convenient. The shuttle bus from the airport was great too. The only complaint we had is that the wifi (free) was super slow. Even the computers in the business center (also free of charge to use) were slow. Overall this hotel is a great deal and we will definitely stay here again - in fact, we booked again to stay there in 2 days before our flight to ibiza. If you want to stay close to airport, this is the perfect hotel to stay at!

Show more
tami , United States
Hotel Osuna

Hostal Buelta met all our criteria of a hotel perfectly. Firstly it was very cheap. The rooms were cleaned daily.

The staff was very friendly , very helpful, and they also spoke english quite well. The room had a relatively fast wifi. The hotel was situated in the best location for site seeing. It had la Reina Sofia one of the most popular museums right at its door step, about 30m away. The museo del Prado, the botanical gardens and the retiro park, were also very close about 10mins walking distance. You could walk to the centre of Madrid if you really wanted to, it was about a 20-30min walk to end up in Plaza Mayor. We used the metro mostly because it was so convenient with the Atocha metro stop located 50m away. The Atocha railway station is also in very close walking distance. If one wanted to catch a taxi to the airport it only cost around 25 to 30 euros. I guess some minor negatives were that the rooms didn't have air-conditioning. However there was a fan, which worked fine and cooling us down in the hot summer days. Also there was no bar fridge in the room. However all in all, i would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone. Especially people who would like to save some money on accommodation because it was one of the best hotels we have stayed in for the price that we payed.

We booked a double room. Not such a good idea because the room had no view. Literally. If you open the windows, you will face a dim shaft facing a few other walls, which didn't make us feel secure at all.

Especially when we called the reception to tell them that our air conditioner was not working, they simply told us to open the windows. If we had a room with a view, that wouldn't be a problem at all. Other than the faulty air conditioner which blew only hot air, we found the floor of the room to be dirty. This hotel is basic with basic services despite the fancy design and decor (we are ashamed to say that we were fooled by the nice decor in the photos on the website). The reception staff are rather unapproachable. The location at Gran Via metro station is prime. However, it is a busy pedestrian street so be careful with your belongings. The policemen patrolling the street made us feel wary of pickpockets rather than safe actually! Other than that we wouldn't fault the location, but note that Praktik Metropol is in a building with other hostals so if you want a better deal (for perhaps a cheaper price and with a nice view), we suggest you google the address of this building.

Needed a hotel in Madrid for a night due to an early flight from Barajas. This hotel is perfectly located at the top of C.

The location of this hostel-hotel is very convenient, but you have to look out for the little hotel sign or else you might miss the location.

The hotel is part of a building, which you have to buzz to get in. Once you're in, you take the stairs up to what I believe was the 2nd or 3rd floor. Once you enter, there's a room to the right, where the receptionist sits. I was traveling with a friend and we booked a room for 2 nights. After we received our room key, we headed to our room and was pleasantly impressed with the quality of the room. It was clean, looked new, the bathroom was nice, and we had a nice street view too. The ONLY negative thing that I can think of was we received a complaint that we made noise. My friend and I were shocked when the receptionist told us this because we were barely in our rooms since we spent most of the 2 days sightseeing. Not only that, but when we got back to our rooms, we were too tired to do anything but shower and sleep. We couldn't imagine why we received that complaint, but keep that in mind when you're booking-- guests tend to be on the quiet side, which is what I prefer anyway. It certainly was not a party-like environment. Safe for all age groups and females, as the building is locked and there's hotel reception 24/7. Overall, comfortable hotel, convenient location for walking distance sightseeing, and great price.

We stayed in two separate areas in Madrid. One was on the edge of Salamanca, so in a conventional upper class area.

The Hotel Ballesta is in a more downtown and somewhat area, but safe and in the end we preferred it to our more upscale accomodation. This was in part because while the hotel is basic and straightforward, the service was excellent, and speaking English possible. (Unlike the more upscale place, and the Ballesta also had a safe.) The room was quiet and clean. We really enjoyed the neighbourhood as it felt more full of locals than tourists and there were a number of little cafes and boutiques that were clearly much loved local businesses. Turn right from the hotel door and you are on Gran Via in 5 minutes. Turn left and walk to the nearest plaza for a coffee or a beer and you will find a more multi-ethnic crowed than is the norm. This area also seems to be both a student area, so there is lots of life--in the best way. I will comment that along Ballesta, day and night, there might be 5-10 women, but the feeling of the street is safe and unless you are interested in them, they have no interest in you. Smaller kids probably would not notice and older kids who have watched TV have seen more. We would definitley consider staying here again.

The hotel occupies 1 entire floor of a building which is shared with other tenants. There is a lift which would take you up.

The hotel is well-situated with 2 different metro lines within walking distance. I booked a double room, it was small but cozy. As it was a short stay and I had intended to spend most of my time outside, the room size was irrelevant. The room was clean though. If you intend to take a taxi to the hotel, I would suggest that you print out the address of the hotel and not all taxis would know the location as it is on a small street. Also, it may be useful to google maps the location of the hotel as the hotel signage is small and not very obvious. As the room rates are cheap, I think expectations should be adjusted accordingly. It is afterall a 1 star hotel. The room does not come with a safe or fridge but there are vending machines outside in the lounge area. Wifi is free but does get patchy in the rooms. If you need wifi, you can always walk out to the lounge area. They offer free muffins and biscuits with a vending machine that has coffee and tea in the mornings. Reception was extremely helpful. Although there is no taxi station near the hotel, you can flag one off the street in front of the hotel. Rooms that are located facing the reception and vending machines area could be noisy as they see more human traffic. In all, I would stay in this hotel again if I was on a tight budget.

Pros: -Sunny room with excellent view -Excellent Location (very central, 1 minute walk from Plaza Mayor and 5 minutes from Puerta del Sol) -Clean Cons: -Noisy -Room was bright at night -Safe costs 1Euro I requested a room on the main plaza and we got a lovely room with lots of sunshine and two windows - one looking on the plaza and the other on the side street.

The room was pleasant, clean, and comfortable. The only reason I wouldn't necessarily recommend this hostel to other people is because I found it difficult to sleep at night. I wouldn't recommend it to light sleepers - the room was noisy (we could hear other guests in the hallway because the walls were thin. Also, the reception was just outside of our door so we could hear the doorbell ringing several times through the night) and bright (there were no blackout curtains and they lit up their sign at night, so lots of light came in through the windows while we were trying to sleep). If you are not a light sleeper, this is a nice place (excellent central location!!) to stay at a good value. My last comment is that I think it was kind of tacky that they charged 1 Euro for use of the safe in the room!

getting to the apartment was straight forward on the metro, with anton martin station a couple of minutes walk away.

we bought 3 day metro pass and saved a killing. when we turned up outside the apartments we were some what confused, a narrow street, no signs on the door, it seemed like we were at a residential block....and we were, only madrid4rentals have purchased many of them. a phone call made and 10 minutes later we were in our top floor duplex apartment which was stunning, just mind your head on the low ceilings. my initial concern over the location was soon forgotten. the area was fantastic and very few tourists about. surrounded by shops and small cafe's visited by locals. retiro park is only a 10 minute walk away, turn right out of the apartment and walk down to the main road, cross over and walk up the hill to the park! the park has a nice lake where you can hire a row boat, we did this twice. the city centre sol is within a 15 minute walk or easily reached on the metro, as is the plaza mayor which is well worth a visit but full of tourists and street performers. we stayed more local, as the apartment is located in heurtas, a lively area at night with many squares/terraces to eat/drink at until the early hours. i would definitely recommend these apartments! 10/10.

Traveler impressions of Madrid

Madrid is a very architectural city which is rich in history and culture. I Loved the way they kept the city, especially the old and high-tech have been combined to give a feel good scenerio.

Hussain ,India

It's a small city and can be covered in about 3 days, if like to travel out of the city centre, there are a few good options as well.

Hah ,Singapore

Do not underestimate the powerful combo of outstanding museums and cultural events with a super happening night life and gastronomic choices.

Boada ,Spain

I need to go back. We went when a lot of chefs are on vacation, which was a pain as its so well known!

Wood ,Canada

Madriad is at the center of Spain for trains and flights. There are many interesting activities within the city before taking side trips to South Spain and other cities.

Fung ,Hong Kong

Many great restaurants in the city center and adjacent neighborhoods. If you are in the city center, be sure to visit Mercado San Miguel for amazing food -- many food stalls with tapas, wine, bakeries, fresh food.

Grimm ,United States

We took the hop on hop off city bus tour which gave us a fantastic overview of the city. The Prado Museum was incredible, a must see.

We had delicious meals with very good wines, for decent prices. Overall, a wonderful, memorable, experience and would like to give credit to people dealing with so many tourists for being so helpful. Julia Travel deserves recognition for being a great tour company, efficient, fun, informative, great guides and bus drivers, providing very positive, memorable experiences.

More about Madrid

Madrid is Spain’s capital city, and a favorite among world travelers. The modern metropolis is home to some of the most stunning architecture and artistic heritage in Europe. The city attracts many visitors, and there’s no shortage of accommodations or activities in this cosmopolitan city. Gothic cathedrals and immense neo-classical buildings are abundant throughout the city, while the centrally-located Plaza Mayor functions as the city's public meeting place and administrative center.

Hotels near Madrid-Barajas International Airport are linked to Madrid city center via metro, or travelers can easily find a Madrid city center hotel around Opera and Sol, the two most popular zones in the city center.

The major museums in the city are located near metro stops and sightseers can walk from one to the next. Many Madrid hotels are near city attractions, including the famous Museo Del Prado, which is home to an impressive classical art collection. Art enthusiasts would do well to visit the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum of Art, which contains masterpieces by renowned artists such as Van Gogh and Picasso.

Among Madrid’s stunning architecture is of course the Palacio Real , a massive palace where one can spend hours imagining what life must have been like for Spain’s royals.

Madrid’s Park of the Pleasant Retreat, known locally as El Retiro, is a massive public park offering a natural escape in the middle of the city. It’s easy to see why this natural treasure is often referred to as the Central Park of Madrid. There’s no shortage of exciting nightlife in Madrid, and the locals are just as active participants as the vacationers in the city.

The modern metropolis is home to some of the most stunning architecture and artistic heritage in Europe. The city attracts many visitors, and there’s no shortage of accommodations or activities in this cosmopolitan city. Gothic cathedrals and immense neo-classical buildings are abundant throughout the city, while the centrally-located Plaza Mayor functions as the city's public meeting place and administrative center. Hotels near Madrid-Barajas International Airport are linked to Madrid city center via metro, or travelers can easily find a Madrid city center hotel around Opera and Sol, the two most popular zones in the city center. The major museums in the city are located near metro stops and sightseers can walk from one to the next. Many Madrid hotels are near city attractions, including the famous Museo Del Prado, which is home to an impressive classical art collection. Art enthusiasts would do well to visit the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum of Art, which contains masterpieces by renowned artists such as Van Gogh and Picasso. Among Madrid’s stunning architecture is of course the Palacio Real , a massive palace where one can spend hours imagining what life must have been like for Spain’s royals. Madrid’s Park of the Pleasant Retreat, known locally as El Retiro , is a massive public park offering a natural escape in the middle of the city. It’s easy to see why this natural treasure is often referred to as the Central Park of Madrid. There’s no shortage of exciting nightlife in Madrid, and the locals are just as active participants as the vacationers in the city.
